passage.title: The gold watch
passage.paragraph: When a boy is taking his father's meal to the factory, he stops for a moment to watch a worker cleaning the sewer.
The boy says, "My mother drops her gold watch down here yesterday."
The worker's eyes becomes wide. "Well, my boy," he says. "Get along with you."
An hour later, the boy comes back. "Are you sure there is a gold watch here?" asks the worker.
"I'm quite sure," answers the boy with a smile. "Because I see my father get it out. I see it with my own eyes."
